description:
Cute little cafe on the corner filled with succulents!
They got limited but good food options on the menu with some coffees and teas. Noticed they serve Intelligentsia coffee here. And you get a cheese pop free with a hot drink!
I got the classic parmesan cheese pop (pao de queijo) with my coffee. It is not your traditional cheesy bread pop. It is made with cassava. The place also makes sliders out of the cheese pops. 
The empanadas section was quite interesting too. 
Good food overall and great service.
author: Sai J.

description:
Brazilian cheese bread comes with every hot drink?! Sign me up!

So good. Cute little find. Worth it to stop in and check it out. Not a huge variety but its a cute, quick stop. Plus, who else has brazilian cheese bread?
author: Taylor W.

description:
Great coffee and amazing empanadas and cheese puffs. They also have sweets and juices I just haven't tried them yet.

Perfect local cafe for a quick coffee or snack.
author: Ken B.

description:
First time here and I'm enjoying myself very much. It's a great place to read or get some work done! This place has relaxing and upbeat music with and large inviting Windows. When I first walked in, I was pleasantly surprised that the heater was turned on. After sitting in here for 10 minutes, I had to take off my scar and then my jacket, wishing it was less warm as it became stuffy. Anyway...

I'm a little disappointed they don't do chai lattes here, BUT the tea is good and it comes with a delicious popover! I chose the Parmesan one, found it to be so good that I ordered two more--one parm and one guava. They're slightly crispy/crunchy on the outside with a soft, gooey-like interior. The texture is quite pleasant. The parm one is cheesy and savory, so delicious! The guava one tastes like guava and is just the right amount of sweetness. It didn't have as much guava filling as some of the their pictures I saw though. Both are great with tea!  

I'll def be back for more tea and popovers!
author: Angie Y.

description:
I came to this cafe with my sister and her friends on a Saturday morning and it was not busy at all. This is a small and intimate shop with limited seating so it's not ideal for big groups. I think a lot of people tend to grab and go rather than sit down so I think you would be able to find a place to seat if you plan to dine-in. The shop seems to be run by just one guy (at least when we were there), so the service can be a bit on the slower end, but the wait is not bad at all. 

My favorite part of this place is that they give you a FREE cheese puff with any hot drink purchases. This includes any of the coffees and teas but excludes the juices. There are a couple of different flavors for the cheese puffs that you can order in addition but the cheese puff that comes with the drink is the original one. I absolutely loved the texture of the cheese puffs. It reminded me of the mocha bread at Asian bakery sometimes since it's pretty chewy. My sister had ordered a guava cheese puffs with her orange juice, and I was a little surprised that the guava cheese puffs are still on the more savory side. The cheese flavor for these cheese puffs are pretty strong so they are on the savory end even if you order the sweeter flavors like guava. 

I had ordered the tea with turmeric and ginger because I was feeling a bit under the weather and it was pretty good. It was definitely on the lighter side but I just liked that they had the option that seemed to hit the spot for someone who wasn't feeling well. It was a great alternative to the coffee drinks.

The menu was pretty simple, which I liked. They also have free wifi! I think this is a nice little cafe and would love to come back and try out the other cheese puff flavors.
author: Nina W.

description:
My friends and I took a field trip to the Legion of Honor museum one morning, and the best part was coming to Saltroot Cafe afterwards. The exhibit wasn't as thrilling as coming here to have a coffee and try their incredible food. It's a small and quaint cafe, but we managed to secure a table in the corner.

Each beverage comes with a cheese pop-ups, which looks so simple but makes your taste buds explode with joy. It's dangerous that they sell these for taking home... I could sit in front of Netflix and snack on them forever. The empanadas are amazing, too. So fresh, flaky, and tasty.

Everything about the experience at Saltroot Cafe is carefully crafted. It feels casual yet classy to be here. The combination of the furniture, decor, and presentation of coffee and pastries creates the perfect environment to relax and have a good conversation with friends. Or spend some "me time" one afternoon. One of the most memorable cafes in San Francisco, I'd say!
author: Stefanie C.

description: Coffee quality is amazing. Also ordered the Juice. Everything is tasty. You can't ask for more.
author: Naiyah P.

description:
This was a happy discovery after the walk in Lands End and China Beach.
A cute little cafe with great choice of tea cups and relaxing atmosphere. All hot drinks come with a little Brazilian cheese pupup that tasted amazing.
author: Aya M.

description:
Location- I was interested in this shop since I saw that they had the puffs. It's also a really covenient spot to go to since it has an OK amount of parking near the little tennis courts. 

Food- OMG the cheese and guava puffs are amazing!! I could not stop. I got the hot chocolate along with my puffs. Let me tell you, everything was pretty delicious. It's a great spot for a little before dinner, post dinner snack.

Overall- It's a tiny spot, but I haven't had an issue finding a seat. The lady was also pretty nice.  It's also a nice place to get some work done. I'd come back, especially for the puffs.
author: Lyra C.

description:
We were just looking for wifi. We found it, and also discovered the amazing cheese pops, or puffs, or whatever these balls of deliciousness are called. The food menu is not extensive, but definitely some tasty looking options, including four kinds of empanadas. I got the green juice, which was legit cold press with the usual suspects, plus two of the cheese puffs as an afterthought. They were hot and airy and chewy. How have I gotten this far in life without having experienced their magnificence before?!

I was doing a crammed work session with a friend and working from a laptop, taking advantage of their speedy free WiFi. We knew from the hours listed that the cafe was closing soon, but were trying to crank through some problems. The woman working was soooo nice about it. She brought over two cheese puffs on the house, and very politely said, just to give you a heads up, we will be closing soon. We were there a few minutes after official closing, but she was very nice about it. 

Definitely worth a visit if you're in the hood--nice place to stop for a snack after a Legion of Honor visit.
author: gail b.

description: Love this place, great neighborhood feel in outer Richmond. Small plates, coffee and cheese popups are delicious.
author: Nick E.

description: Super cute mom and pop coffee shop! I used to come here ALL the time since I used to live 2 blocks away from here. I moved to the East Bay so haven't been since but I crave their cheese pops! Next time I'm in the area, I'm definitely going to buy a bag of their frozen cheese pops in bulk :)
author: Alex C.

description:
It took me 14 years in the US to find a tasty and fresh cheese bread (pão de queijo) like this ! Pão de queijo is a famous snack in Brazil and you can find easily anywhere in Brazil.
Homemade, fresh and delicious pão de queijo ! You won't be disappointed!
author: Re A.

description:
The popup that came with my latte was amazing. Chewy on the inside, crusty on the outside, and with just the right amount of jam. I wish I had more! 

The salami olive popup had individually good ingredients. My only hesitation was the proportion of the salami--too salty for my taste. I liked it when less salami allowed the olive fragrance to come through more. Again, perfect texture on all popups.
author: Y O.

description:
Delicious neighborhood spot! I passed by this cute little corner shop during a walk to Land's End and am so glad I went inside.

Got an oat milk latte and it came with a cheese popup - so yummy! I chose the guava one which was crispy/gooey and salty/sweet. Coffee was great as well (Intelligentsia). Plus, friendly service!
author: Maayan C.

description:
Where have cheese pop-ups been all my life?! 

These pop-ups are amazing savory treats for the afternoon 'snacking hour,' or any time ... my number one discovery of 2017, for sure. 

This little cafe sells a variety of these hand-made goodies, and I recommend trying them all!  You can even get frozen versions to take home and bake fresh - they'd make a great party appetizer or side! 

The couple who owns this business is awesome, and you can generally find one of them behind the counter - happy to tell you more about the pop-ups and how they're made.

There aren't too many options overall (the cheese pop-ups, some empanadas, juices, coffee) ... but this is a great spot to stop for a snack or light lunch, by yourself or to chat over the yumminess with a friend (or some work and your laptop).
author: Catie F.

description:
Very cute and cozy cafe. Lots of seating, good wifi, and well-lit. This is one of my favorite study/work spots. Each of the tables has a really cute plant on it.

Their drink selection is standard but the best part is all their hot drinks come with a free CHEESE POPUP. They are delicious and you can buy some frozen ones to take home with you. I usually get a latte with oatmilk.
author: Kelly T.

description:
Delicious Brazilian cheese popups and good (Intelligentsia) coffee. Empanadas are good too, with vegetarian options available. Olive oil, Tabasco, salt and pepper available if needed to add more flavor. 

Every coffee drinks comes with a cheese popup which reminds me of a Cheez-It, but chewy/bouncy in the mouth. Yum! Husband has been to Brazil and said it tastes like those he had there, so it's legit (not that I doubted it bc the owners came from Brazil). So I definitely recommend. The popups are made of cassava flour, so they are gluten-free. Plus you can also purchase them frozen to bake at home. 

Place is small but cute. Owner who took our orders was super nice and friendly. There is free wifi, but did not see a restroom.
author: Iris H.

description: Wonderful to have Saltroot open in the neighborhood. I tried their  Brazilan cheese pop ups and they are delicious warm out of their oven!  Even better yet, you can buy the frozen pop ups and bring the home to bake for parties.  There are five varieties (Parmesan, Guava, Gorgonzola, Parsley and Onion and Potato Mustard).  My favorite is the Parmesan!
author: Lena L.

description:
Stopped by for a drink and a snack after doing the Land's End hike. 

I already had coffee that day so I got a hot cacao which comes with a cheese popup, which seems to be what the cafe is known for.
http://bit.ly/2oUNfeu

I was disappointed by the cheese popup, it was fine but didn't really amaze me as I was expecting based on the yelp reviews. The texture was a bit chewy and you can definitely taste the cheese. Maybe it would've been better warm? Or maybe I just straight up don't care for them. I mean I'd eat it if someone put them in front of me as a snack but I wouldn't want to make my way here just to get them. 

What disappointed me even more was the hot cocoa. It was pretty bland as far as hot cocoa goes, in terms of flavor as well as texture. I felt like I could've made a better cup at home.

The cashier was nice and friendly and the decor was homey, but I'll most likely not return.
author: Lily L.

description: Worth coming by for a visit if in the area.  I had a delicious hot cocoa and a tasty Corn empanada.  I'm not a big fan of the cheese popup, but it's free!
author: Karen L.

description: Great small business that I'm happy to support. When I arrived this morning, the owner was still baking the pop-ups but the 10 minute wait was worth it. They came out piping hot and are as delicious as people on here say. I brought some to work and people were fighting over who gets the last one. Two co-workers even decided to go after work and check it out. I also ordered a green juice, which is tasty and healthy but at $6, more of a treat item for me. There are two larger tables for getting work done and when I was here on a weekday morning, it wasn't crowded. Highly recommend if you're in the area!
author: Melissa T.

description:
The former Pineapples Kingdom bubble tea shop was carefully beautified, and appears larger. Cute framed quotations decorate the space.

I was warmly greeted by the owner, and offered a pao de queijo for free. It is light, slightly cheese flavored and very good. 

They offer nice pastries, coffee and freshly made green and orange healthy juices. Stop in when you're nearby and support a neighborhood business. I'll return for the tasty pao de queijo.
author: Carol W.

description: Just found this little spot on Yelp, and I'm in love! It has such a cozy feel and great for study dates. The coffee is just right (not too bitter like some places) and the CHEESE POPUPS are amazing! Such flavor packed in to these delicate little pastries. I've never had anything like it and will be coming back!
author: Jessica W.

description: What a cute little café. Came here on a Saturday evening and ordered a chocolate chip cookie ($2.50) and the Ghirardelli Hot Cocoa ($3) and it was exactly what I expected, sweet and rich. The worker was so nice he even gave me a free cheese popup which tasted pretty good, you should definitely try it. Would definitely come back here again!
author: Samantha W.

description: Cute little coffee shop with delicious gluten-free cheese pop ups! Affordable and delicious!
author: Masha S.

description: Found this spot by chance driving by one morning. I'm a big fan of these small, family-owned cafes, so I couldn't stay away. The granola, berries and yogurt are a great deal, but their true specialty are the warm cheese puffs-- one comes from with a coffee, so grab a cappuccino and enjoy. The place is cozy, but there always seems to be a seat-- early bird does get the worm though. Support small biz!
author: Brian J.

description: Great Brazilian Cafe. The coffee and treats are delicious. The owner is super nice! Must support local cafes.
author: Wayne S.

description: Finally a place that makes real pão de queijo! Compared to the ones people are accustomed to eating around town these should be considered a gourmet version of that. So happy I found this place. Looking forward to trying all the different flavors. Today I had the Parmesan and the Onion and Parley. Both equally fantastic. Perfect crispy outside and gooey inside. They should make a point in letting people it's gluten free.
author: Claudia B.

description:
So this afternoon I stumbled in this cafe because I've been wanting to try it. I walked in & the people (a man & woman) behind the counter was prepping an order so I waited about 2 minutes perusing the menu before the lady took my order. I ordered the fresh green juice & the popup plate. (Look on their menu of what it is) I don't want to say the wrong thing but it's salami, the cheese popup, olives with perhaps some kind of oil. It comes with three.
 It was absolutely delicious & filling. She freshly prepared the juice & the plate while I watched & waited. It's a small mom & pop cafe. The only thing I would say slightly negative  is their juices come in a small, skinny glass. Perhaps 8oz for $6. Kinda steep but I will come back because next I want to try the organic turmeric tea. Yum!
author: Traci T.

description: Complimentary cheese popup with a hot drink! What more need I say? The whole cafe is well lit by natural lighting, making it a great place to study. (Another plus: the wifi is really fast!) I've never had trouble finding a table here, whether it be a weekday or a weekend.
author: Tiffany K.

description: Quaint, cozy cafe with free WiFi. Stopped in for a quick snack of cheese pop ups and an empanada. Tried 3 different flavors of pop ups: Gorgonzola, Parmesan and guava. The pop ups reminded me of popovers, but more dense and doughy. Flavor and texture was okay, but not particularly noteworthy. 10 pop ups and an egg and onion empanada set me back ~$20.  I wouldn't specifically come back for the food, but seemed like a cute place to work or study if you're living in the area.
author: Selina T.

description: Ordered a latte with almond milk and was offered a cheese pop up  (one comes with certain drink purchases.) She said they usually have a vegan one but didn't have any baked.  I opted to try one anyway, even though it's against my current diet.  It was very tasty and naturally gluten free. I'm not a big coffee drinker but was wanting something afyer spending hours in the rain. It tasted different, but the more I drank the more I liked it. There are 3 organic sugars; coconut, cane, and brown. It is a very small cafe, only 12 chairs, but there are outlets and there's wifi.
author: Jenne S.

description:
Came in on a weekday morning for some drinks and a snack. We got some guava and parmesan popups, organic juice and coffee. The popups were amazing! I really liked the parmesan ones, but guava was pretty interesting - I don't think I've had anything similar before.

Also, this is a cute little place with a nice atmosphere and a friendly owner.
author: Geil M.

description:
Saltroot Cafe was an unexpected pleasure. surprised to learn Intelligensia coffee is the brew and Brazilian snacks (cheese popups, empanadas) are the eats. (along with muffins, cookies, cakes, etc.)

eats are made in a house nearby (allowed by a recently passed calif. law)
brew: intellgentsia coffee (3)
-mellow, smooth, silky brew, not robust
came with a free cheese popup.

eats: pao de queijo (cheese popup)
-eat right away while hot. yummy! not sure about taste when it cools.
-fillings available, many flavors
empanada (6) also in plain view.

parking notes:
-not easy, garage next to shop on side street rented by cafe, can park there

news on note:
-"Top Trump Aide accused of breaking criminal conflict of interest law:"
(common dreams, 3/14
author: Victor G.

description:
Came here to meet someone on a date. We randomly chose this place as it looked liked it'd
have good coffee. I paced around a little bit and saw these Brazilian cheese puffs. The 3-puff plate looked delicious, but I decided to wait. 

I got an iced latte, and it was just wonderful. I hold all my iced lattes to the blue bottle standard and this was maybe even better. But back to the cheese puffs. They are so good. It's like biting into a crispy croissant only to be greeted by the warm perfect texture of melted cheese. Think of these like melted cheese sandwiches, but in delicious cassava root croissant-like bread. I'm gluten sensitive and this was perfect to find out. Jesus Christ these cheese puffs were good. I'm really thankful to my date (who does not know that I'm talking about her) for suggesting this as a meetup spot. I rarely ever venture far from my neighborhood for food items. But after tasting these cheese puffs, I'm determined to come back with a cooler to stuff full of frozen cheese puffs to bake at home. 

Sorry for the wordy review. This stuff was delicious. The coffee alone is worth coming for too if you don't care for cheese puffs. But try the cheese puffs.
author: Nick W.

description: Cheese popups are AMAZING. comes w some of the drink purchases. You can get it frozen/ready to bake as well. Atmosphere is nice. I found outlets, wifi, a big table, it wasn't too busy, perfect to journal and drink coffee and hang out in. The lady was really nice. They also have some juices and teas. My new favorite place.
author: Soo L.

description: I found myself in complete relaxation mode when I spent some time here in this cafe. A friend mentioned this to me once so tried to see it on my own. For sure I wasn't disappointed with this place. Nice and unique atmosphere. Great service and most of all, the coffee here tasted really good. Smooth and tasty. Definitely worth going back to again!
author: Jared W.

description:
Relaxed atmosphere, free WiFi, lovely music and friendly customer service. And the food is noms.

Found the Tapas styles pão de queijo interesting so ordered. It does it justice and I like that these have a firmer outer crust (still chewy/fluffy inside!), making the bocaditos easier to hold.

Thumbs up for lunch/snack foods!
author: Ellie M.

description:
**VERY VEGAN FRIENDLY** 

So happy this is in the neighborhood. I used to live on 23rd but moved away and still work in the Richmond so this is a great quick filling, yummy, hearty lunch for me. The 10 pack of the pop-ups are a great deal. Light, fluffy, savory, and filling. The vegan-mustard-potato kind is my favorite. The vegan empenadas are wonderful too. (love the cheese and corn)

The owners are so friendly too and accommodate large orders (my work ordered probably 50 pop-ups at one time and he was awesome).

Highly recommend!
author: Adelaide M.

description: Do not walk, but run here!  What a special treat for this neighborhood! Forget Starbucks or another impersonal coffee shop. The owner has done it the right way here. You feel the passion and love to everything she does! Support this local place!!
author: Sir Paul L.

description: You get free cheese pop up (little cheesy pastry) with your coffee drink! The pop ups are gluten free and if you wait a few minutes she can even make a vegan version.
author: Brigid B.

description: It's a cute cozy cafe great for studying and just chilling on a Sunday !  :) the americano was good and it came with a cheese pop up (AMAZING! Would definitely recommend)
author: Bonnie Y.

description: What a tiny pocket of deliciousness. I think I tried one of everything and it was all so good. The proprietress was friendly and knowledgeable and spoke to us about the healthy food she served.
author: Becky T.

description: I absolutely love Saltroot and drive out here just for the cheese pop ups.  They are seriously the most delicious item ever!  Buy a frozen bag to take home.  I love the tea that has pepper, turmeric and ginger.  Don't miss this spot!
author: Jaime F.

description: I was genuinely excited to try this place out as it is very close to me and I read such great reviews. However as I entered the cafe, the owner actually looked me up and down as I approached her at the register. She was unwelcoming and didn't smile once. And with the yelp reviews, it seems that a free cheese puff comes with a drink order but I was not given one. Needless to say, I will not be coming back.
author: Kim Y.

description: This place is adorable! Great coffee and ambiance in a tiny corner cafe. A regular coffee is $3 and comes with a cheese popup - the best deal you can get anywhere in the city! The texture of the popup is like biting into a small cloud that just happens to be filled with cheese. Please come if only for the popups.
author: Cherise C.

description:
Cheese Pop-ups!!!! Is it possible to eat too many of these? I think not. Such a beautiful space and kind, kid-friendly owners. Loving this spot.

 Definitely take home the frozen pop-ups to go...makes a great group snack, party appetizer or breakfast.
author: Anne D.

description: Came here after a morning at the Legion of Honor.  Everything was very delicious and fresh, and did not feel heavy.  I would certainly come again.  The menu is small, but all well presented.  Do bear in mind that it is a small operation with an unusual offering, and you may find a little wait.
author: Anne G.

description:
Brownie points: You get a free cheese pop with every hot drink. That was pretty cool, because from the reviews the cheese pops and empanadas are definitely supposed to be the highlights. Since I've never had a Brazilian cheese pop before, I love that I got to try one for free! 

I personally am a bit of a coffee snob, so I loved that they had Intelligentsia Coffee - it's why I was willing to try this spot is the first place. Being familiar with third wave coffee, I'm always willing to pay pretty large sums for my morning joe. But while a $5 cappuccino won't scare me off, I do expect high quality barista skills to go with that price point and I wouldn't say that's what they offer... there was that free cheese pop though so maybe that balances it out? 

Will probably be back to try their empanadas. Also, might come buy to buy some frozen cheese pops for a party snack or something.
author: Rachel E.

description: Best pão de queijo I've had outside of Brazil! Their empanadas are also delicious. The owners are friendly and inviting. I always grab a bag of frozen cheese pop ups to cook at home, be careful they're an addicting snack!
author: Heather M.

description: Stopped by on the way to the beach after looking for a coffee shop online, and found this gem. Super cute coffee shop- delicious too! Not too large but good coffee and free cheese ball with my purchase. I ordered a mocha with an extra shot to go. Would recommend. Nice decor inside with succulents!
author: Britney S.

description: Incredible assortment of vegetarian and vegan options. Great service, free wifi. Great coffee (almond and oat milk!) and a free snack with every hot drink. How can you go wrong here? Look for their speciality cheese (including vegan!) popups around Nob Hill too.
author: Nic F.

description:
1. Yummy popups 
2. Nice people
3. Nice decor 
4. Finally found coffee my boyf likes in the Richmond
author: Anna K.

description: This is now my favorite coffee shop. I've been coming here for a few months now. The atmosphere is warm and cozy, calm and bright. The coffee is fantastic, served with a cheese popup. I always order extra of these because they are so unique and delicious! The service is also excellent. They are so aware of and responsive to any need you may have. Whether it's helping me clean up a spill or giving me two apples instead of the one I purchased "because they are small", these guys make me feel taken care of. It's such a comfortable environment. And they even have a bunch of plugs for all your charging needs.
author: Natalie W.

description: Small local cafe. Cheese pop ups taste great! Very small business feel with friendly service. Nice hangout place with nice music going to have a afternoon tea/coffee/juice and snacks or study/work.
author: Csrocker C.

description: What a great new spot for light lunch and a beverage - I had coffee.  Wow!   Try the tomato basil popups!!!
author: Lance D.

description: So amazing , this place is very pleasant and delicious. The people running it are very welcoming and it makes an awesome vibe to study or enjoy a nice brunch with all organic recipes  highly recommend you try the different flavors of pao de queijo
author: Brëde F.

description:
Don't come here to get work done. After doing a bit of searching on yelp for another cafe to work at in my neighborhood, I found Saltroot, which numerous reviewers said would be a good place to study/work.

The place is small. Which is totally fine - it is well lit with natural lighting and big windows, and simple decorations to make it feel homey. But its size means that even two people having a conversation with each other will take over the entire environment and make you, willing or not, a listener. Maybe I was just unlucky with timing, with numerous chatty Cathy's and one lady on her phone (why people do this in cafes where people are obviously working as opposed to taking their call outside is beyond me). 

In regards to their food/beverages offerings, I had a smoothie. It was just alright if I'm being honest.
author: Natalie H.

description:
My Wife and I just stopped in to try this place out...

We ordered the Cheese Popups, They were excellent !!!

My Wife is from Brazil, so she was able to speak to Juliana in her native Portuguese...

Cute little place, nice ambiance...

We will be going back :)

Laurence
author: Laurence F.

description: A cute little place with great drinks and atmosphere! The cheesepopups come with each drink and they're amazing :) there's free wifi so it's a great place to work and relax
author: Yasmeen A.

description: Cheese popups (pão de queso) is delicious !! Service is friendly and coffee is great.
author: Allison D.

description:
Cheese pop ups are great. Worth trying!
Had some good empanadas as well. 

This place is great for a quick snack or getting a fresh juice
author: Jacob and Brianne H.

description: Simple but very welcomed place. Good selection of drinks and desserts. Every time coffee is so tasty. Friendly service. Every morning try to visited this place.
author: Apphia C.

description:
I am thrilled Saltroot opened a block away from my house! My kids and I love finding a local cafe to make our regular spot, and this is it. Day one and John and Julianna are so friendly, welcoming and excited to be here. Had the cheese popups, loved by my daughter and husband, the fresh made green juice, so delicious, and the chocolate chip cookie, big enough to share!

The space is clean and comfortable. I just hope the middle school crowd doesn't overrun it...

Right now hours are daily 7:30am-7:30pm, unless they find timing that works better. I warned them that we'd see them again...every day!!
author: Kaitlin K.

description:
Limited, but unique menu -- focusing on brazilian cheese bread and empanadas -- though they also had a few muffins, cookies, juices and a granola/yogurt option when we were there. The coffee was a little on the pricey side ($5 for a latte), but each drink came with a cheese pop-up so it probably wasn't too bad of a deal once you take the tasty bite into account.

My husband and I ordered a latte and a drip coffee, two empanadas (one spinach and feta, the other mushroom and gorgonzola) and two cheese popups (so we got four total, taking the complimentary ones into account). The pop ups come in a variety of flavors. We had two plain, one guava, and one mustard potato. 

Coffee: The beans are from intelligentsia. Both coffee drinks were solid. The latte came out blazing hot, but was quite tasty once it was cool enough to drink. 

Empanadas: Very flavorful filling, yummy tasty crust. They're not very big but they're pretty rich, so one each was plenty for us (especially with the cheese pop ups).

Cheese bread: Chewier than I was expecting, but that's not a bad thing. The one we had right out of the oven was soft and warm...yum. The others were tasty too. The flavored ones were fun to try, but I think my favorite was the basic cheese pop up. :) FYI you can buy them frozen so you an eat them fresh at home.

Overall: This was a fun place to discover, but probably won't become a destination spot for us because it's a little far from our home base. The staff was super friendly, the ambience is chill, and there aren't very many places in the city to get tasty Brazilian bites, let alone cheesy ones. :) I'd recommend it for anyone looking for a little something different but for whom quality coffee is nonnegotiable.
author: Ali S.

description: Delightful. Great coffee - seems overpriced, but those cheese pop-ups really seal the deal. The frozen ones turn out GREAT at home.
author: Lee O.

description: This is my first time trying Brazilian Cheese Puffs. Freshly baked and they taste so good. You must definitely try them out.
author: Aaron C.

description: Our go-to place on the weekend for a treat. LOVE the popups. Our faves are the guava and parsley onion. They also sell them frozen in packages of 10, and reasonably priced. Perfect for parties. We also treat ourselves to the empanadas. Current fave is the kale and butternut squash. The owners are both friendly and nice.
author: Tora C.

description: A wonderful cafe for neighbors and for a stopover before or after a hike at Land's End or China Beach. The space is intimate and sunny, the owners are kind, and the cheese popups are delightful, gluten-free snacks. The green juice is refreshing, and the Intelligentsia coffee is great. I love it here!
author: Jes L.

description:
Awesome place! Delicious Brazilian cheese popups tasted just like the ones I had in Brazil. 

The coffee was amazing, delicious intelligentsia coffee! They have wifi also! Definitely plan on coming back.

Would also be a great cafe to work or read in!
author: Emily P.

description: An amazing cute coffee shop right near the Lands End trail. They freshly ground the espresso beans for my order and also give a free homemade "popup." Go traditional and get the Parmesan one. Can't wait to come back and try their other drinks and other flavor popups.
author: Joshua M.

description: I was thrilled to discover this place near my workplace. It is a cute cafe run by a really nice couple. I have tried their pao de queijo (Brazilian cheese puffs), empanadas and coffee. All are superb. I had only tried pao de queijo when a Brazilian friend made them, but they seem simple yet tricky to make, so I was happy to find this place. They offer various flavors. I think my favorite is the gorgonzola one. The price is great, too--$3 for coffee and one puff! I also enjoyed their lunch option of three pao with different fillings. They seem healthier than European style pastries (ie, croissants and other butter and sugar laden treats), and FWIW, they are gluten free! They also offer a vegan version, too. Coffee is superb. Empanadas are also tasty, but I haven't tried them as much as the pao de queijo. Parking is tricky, but if you ask the owners, they have a helpful hint.
author: 和子

description: Pao de Queijo (Brazilian cheese puff) is unreal. I had the parsley & onion version. Their coffee is great, too. Highly recommend!
author: Ed J.

description: Love this place! Sitting here now with a lovely turmeric tea, my boyfriend got an iced Americano. We got pão de queijo (traditional Brazilian cheese popups) for free with our drinks! Love the vibe, the food and the service.
author: McKenzie C.

description: Just met the very sweet owner when I got a green juice and coconut water. Cute place and something different in the area!
author: Ellie S.

description: I ordered an ice latte for $5. The ice latte was meh... definitely not the right way of making it, so consider ordering coffee drinks in hot. However, it came with this cheese popup. I chose Parmesan flavor, and it was so delicious and chewey!
author: Jenny W.

description: Great place to stop in for a quick coffee and snack.  Ordered the sandwich plate and coffee.  Everything came out piping hot and tasted fantastic.  Hard to beat.
author: Eric H.

description: Love this place! Super cute. And the cheese brass is so killer. I could eat them forever!
author: Jennifer S.

description: A stone's throw away from the beach, this quaint corner cafe includes a cheesy morsel with your $5 latte. That's enough reason for me to come here again. At only 3 months old, this spot has potential to be a mainstay in this friendly neighborhood. Next time I am in the area, I hope to see more delectable bites from their home country of Brazil *hint hint*
author: Dennis P.

description: Delicious, authentic Brazilian cheese pop-ups, served warm.  Great spot for a cup of coffee and a pop-up.
author: Niland M.

description: Loved the ambiance and location of this cafe. Service was hard working and friendly. The idea of a free pop up with every coffee purchase is brilliant and delicious! They offer a couple of juice options and the green juice is by far the best one I've ever had! Definitely making this place a habit.
author: Taylor D.

description: My LA friends introduced me to Intelligentsia coffee and I'm super excited that Saltroot is offering it!! So good plus their Brazilian roast compliments the delicious (naturally gluten free) Brazilian cheese puffs. I tried the tomato and mozzarella -- what a treat, so fresh and unique.
author: Kim E.

description:
Darling little spot!  Delicious coffees and love the touch of the cheese pop ups.  
Will certainly return again and again.
author: Rachel G.

description:
The cheese puffs --Brazilian pao de queijo -- are delicious and unique. Chewy, cheesy and salty. A great savory!  And gluten-free since they are made from yucca. You can buy them hot or take home a bag of frozen to bake yourself.  The empanadas look great.  Cookies, juices and coffee drinks round out the offerings. 

The small cafe is clean and welcoming. This is a great addition to the hood.
author: eve t.

description: Delicious Cheese Popups. I'm from Minas Gerais, the Brazilian state where the Cheese Popups (namely Pão de Queijo) were created. By having tried so many different Cheese Popups recipes, I really recommend those ones from Saltroot since they taste great and you can tell it's made with high quality ingredients.
author: Henrique G.

description: Finally made it into my neighborhood gem Saltroot.   I got a freshly pressed green juice with kale, apple, carrot, lime, and ginger and a Brazilian cheese pop up (a gluten free savory cheese puff). Both were so yummy! I love how they have converted the space to a bright, airy environment with lots space to work, read, internet surf, and chill. Next time I'll try the empanadas!
author: Gina G.

description: The cheese popups are amazing, such a great little snack to go alongside a morning or afternoon coffee. And the coffee was excellent as well. Definitely a stellar addition to the neighborhood!
author: Christopher A.

description: So glad to have a new cafe in the neighborhood! Saltroot Cafe is bright and clean with simple and elegant decor. Most importantly the staff are friendly and welcoming and the food is delicious and fresh! I ate the kale and butternut squash empeñada to go while I took my baby for a walk -- a very tasty treat!  So great to have vegan and vegetarian options too. Saltroot Cafe unequivocally deserves a 5 star rating!
author: Annalies H.

description: There's nowhere else in San Francisco to get traditional Brazilian cheese popups (pão de queijo) and these are delicious!
author: Ben M.

description: I love the hip atmosphere of this little place and their pastries are great! Cute succulents and wood trays for your drink and pastry. The staff was very friendly, and they had cute compost and recycling bins. This is definitely going to be one of my new reg spots. :)
author: Lara I.

description: I live just a couple blocks from this cafe and had been meaning to drop in. Finally made it in today on a walk home from the nearby CVS. So glad I did! The cashier seemed very sweet. I was sad to see I was the only one there on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. I ordered the green juice and a cheese pop up to go since I saw it was Gluten free! (Bonus star right there!) The juice was freshly squeezed as I waited and was absolutely delicious. So tasty and refreshing. The cheese pops didn't even last me a block. I devoured them immediately. Very yummy, nice and warm. I was given the Parmesan ones. I loved the chewy texture of the pop ups. I'm disappointed in myself that it took me so long to come here. I love supporting small business and Saltroot will most definitely have my returning patronage. I've seen many businesses come and go over the last couple years in this location. I hope this one stays. Thank you Juliana for the delicious breakfast!
author: Amanda M.

description: I love their cheese pop up. Simple math: Coffee+ the pop up =your wonderful afternoon
author: Sam C.

description: I found in San Francisco a pão de queijo like my mom used to do it!! They also have a nice espresso.
author: Daniel P.

description: This is an amazing coffee shop! First off you get a free cheese pop up with very hot drink you purchase. The cheese pop ups are amazing and addictive, I would be a regular if I lived here. As a Hispanic, I'm very familiar with the type of food they have here and it's top notch.
author: Anthony G.

description: Excellent new spot in the neighborhood, the cheese puffs are mad delicious. Coffee is a mite overpriced but it's definitely a snackspot to keep in mind when you're around the area.
author: Samantha D.

description: Wonderful Brazilian cheese bread! Excellent coffee! The owners are wonderful and a great place to practice a little Portuguese and relax with snacks!
author: M M.

description: Very nice please thank you for your cafe. Day one and welcoming and excited to be here. Had the cheese popups, loved by my daughter and husband, the fresh made green juice, so delicious, and the chocolate chip cookie,...
author: Karapet G.

description: Love this place! The cheese popups are a salty goodness that follows your drink order to your table. Nice vibe.
author: Kris R.

description: Cute local place with good service, coffee, and snack options. Free wifi. I like to support local eateries :)
author: MC C.

description: Charming little addition to the neighborhood. Cafe has delicious and affordable organic juices and Brazilian pastries. The owner was an absolute delight. Will be back soon!
author: Valery N.

description: Amazing pão de queijo (cheese popups that are gluten free)! John and Juliana are also very friendly and sweet.
author: Candice M.

description: Very nice little place. Perfect after a morning hike. A great opportunity to taste new pastries types. Great coffee ...
author: Yolanda S.

description: lovely place .. the best cheese popups l've ever tried, the banana muffin is delicious!!
author: Maye G.

description: Three words. Pao. De. Queijo. If that's not a part of your vocabulary it needs to be. Maybe you've traveled extensively through Brazil and know what I'm talking about. Or maybe you're just a hipster foodie who rolls his own on Sunday mornings. But for the rest of us mere mortals running between Korean taco trucks and tonkotsu Ramen specials, let me tell you, you need to stop and smell the queijo. It's these little delightful cheesy puffy thingies but that's like calling Delfina just bread with cheese. It's like a salty cheese-infused golden crusty doughy little puffy thing-a-magic that disappears in a bite. More importantly, I now have a bag in my freezer. Anyway, I digress. As for the yelp review. Great little spot. It's in the outer rims of Clement, where a lot of the good finds are. Good juices, legit coffee, friendly dude with kind of a Justin Timberlake fro behind the counter. But the pao de queijo is what you go for.
author: Sid S.
